text: Pyotr Leonidovich Kapitsa or Peter Kapitza (Russian: Пётр Леонидович Капица, Romanian: Petre Capița (Pyotr Leonidovich Kapitsa. Encyclopædia Britannica – 8 April 1984) was a Soviet physicist and engineer. He was best known for his work in low-temperature physics. He won the 1978 Nobel Prize in Physics. ==References== Category:1894 births Category:1984 deaths Category:Russian physicists Category:Scientists from Moscow
title: Pyotr Kapitsa
